command.name: csv2ofx
command.description: converts a csv file of transactions to an ofx or qif file.

option.name: source
option.description: source mapping to use, defaults to 'mint'

option.name: accountType
option.description: account type to use if no match is found, defaults to 'CHECKING' for OFX and 'Bank' for QIF.

option.name: collapse
option.description: account(s) to summarize by date if the transaction are recorded double entry stlye (e.g. full data export from xero.com or Quickbooks), defaults to 'Accounts Receivable'

option.name: debug
option.description: enables debug mode, displays the options and arguments passed to the parser

option.name: delimiter
option.description: one character field delimiter, defaults to ','

option.name: overwrite
option.description: overwrite destination file if it exists

option.name: primary
option.description: primary account used to pay credit cards, defaults to 'MITFCU Checking'

option.name: transfer
option.description: treats ofx transactions as transfers from one account to another (sets 'category' as the destination account)

option.name: variables
option.description: enables variable mode, displays the value of all program variables

argument.name: srcFile
argument.description: the csv file, enter '$' to read data from standard input

argument.name: destFile
argument.description: (optional) the output file, enter '$' to print to standard output, defaults to '.../csv2of/export/...'
